sentences: Nicha Yontararak (Thai: ณิชา ยนตรรักษ์; born (1997-10-23)October 23, 1997), better known by her nickname and stage name Minnie (Korean: 민니; Thai: มินนี่), is a Thai singer, songwriter and actress based in South Korea.
section: N/A

sentences: She is a member of South Korean girl group (G)I-dle, which debuted on May 2, 2018 under Cube Entertainment.
section: N/A

== Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Influences ===
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Growing up in a family of musicians, Minnie stated that the music video of "A Thousand Miles" by Vanessa Carlton where she starts playing the song while the piano was moving, ignited her dreams as a musician.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She commented, "Ever since I saw that MV, [...] I started thinking that I will sing and play the piano.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: I must become an artist like that".
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She also cites Super Junior whose songs she often sang to while growing up that led her into K-Pop.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Through a magazine interview, Minnie considered American singer Alicia Keys as her role model since her childhood.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She explained that she used to watch a lot of television with her mother when she was a child, and the performance by Keys’ 2003 hit "If I Ain't Got You" was what inspired her to pursue music.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She also cited Australian singer Troye Sivan, Thailand singer Stamp Apiwat and American singer Charlotte Lawrence as one of her inspirations and hopes for a collaboration someday.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===
